Oh. Hmm, well changing the neck should be easy. You just have to remove a few screws and the strings. It's going to be a lot easier than when I install these pickups. (God help me, I can't solder.)

Yeah, I normally visit St.John's, but they don't stock a lot of parts. The only pickups I could find there were P-Bass ones. I like spaceman, but they don't seem to carry any Fenders, which is a bummer.

WRITING.TITLE: [M 16] Good results with /r/amiugly, so what do you guys think?
WRITING.TEXT:
Sorry for the slightly grainy photo.
http://i.imgur.com/Yq1UI.jpg
I would recommend it, but be careful. Practice on your oldest, crappiest bass the you never play anymore, you don't want to damage the instrument.
I hope you're joking. They were actually 99.

Well, my hair is about medium length, too short to wear without any product. What I normally do is towel dry it, take a medium sized hunk of the Axe Messy Look Paste and spread it through my hair a bit, and then go through it with a towel and pat it down. I let it stay like that for about half an hour and then I mess it up with a towel one last time to dry it and pat it down again. Normally it turns out looking pretty stupid, but every once in a while it looks really cool, like in the pictures. It's a hit or miss thing, really.
DICKS
Wow, thanks. I never bothered to search for that. Upvote for you, good sir.
Yeah the only problem I'm having (other than money) is that buying left handed pick guards is a bitch.

WRITING.TEXT: The haircut I got last was actually intended to be a faux hawk, a bit shorter on the sides and longer in the middle. But then I realized it looked retarded as hell, so I just put some remoldable paste in my hair and kind of brush it to one side. Sorry for the bad description I can't remember the EXACT hair cut that I got.
No, I appreciate any positive comment. Thanks, by the way.
Thanks :)

WRITING.TITLE: Took some commenter's advice, how do I look now? [M]
WRITING.TEXT:
I'm sixteen, even though I look a bit young, and I posted here a while ago and got some good responses, but some people said my photos were sorta stupid and to loose the hair cut I had then. I lost the bieber haircut and tried to stop making that stupid expression I had in my other photos. I'm not quite confident of how good I look now, so what do you guys think? Sorry for all the different links, by the way.

WRITING.TITLE: Most of the snow just melted where I live. This is all I see outside now.
What modern song do you think will be considered a classic in twenty odd years?
WRITING.TEXT:
I'm thinking American Idiot would be up there, considering the critical response the entire album got.
So, Reddit, what songs that have been released in like the 2000's do you think will be, in the future, considered classics like "Bohemian Rhapsody", "Hard Day's Night", "London Calling" etc.?
My friend and I made a bet that he had to give me five bucks for every pair of Beats we saw in the halls. He owes me a lot of money now.
